Textile and manufacturing industries can operate at 100 capacity for both a day and night shift. Conferences and workshops can be held but numbers are restricted to 50% of the conference venue capacity.  Restaurants and fast food outlets may operate with 50% seated capacity between 6am and 10pm. As of December,15,2021, authorities in Zimbabwe have extended domestic COVID-19 measures until at least January,01,2022. The following measures are in effects: Business may operate 07:00-19:00 daily. Access to night-clubs, restaurants, and bars is restricted to vaccinated people. Bars and restaurants will be required to close 19:00. Hotels and lodges have been asked to provide room services to prevent guests from congregating in restaurants. Gymnasium, health spas, and fitness centres remain open to vaccinated clients, staff, and athletes. Cinemas, theatres and national art galleries are open with 50% sitting capacity, but only for vaccinated people. Government activities are scaled down to 30% for essential services.
